title: Glasgow airport partly evacuated due to concerns over suspicious cargo
text:
The international area of Glasgow airport has been evacuated due to concerns over a piece of suspect cargo on an incoming KLM aircraft.

Fire services are at the scene dealing with the incident.

Images shared on social media by an eyewitness showed fire engines and emergency services lined up at the airport.

A spokesperson for Glasgow Airport said: “At approximately 10am today, the airport fire service attended an arriving KLM flight in response to concerns raised over a piece of cargo.

"Enquiries are ongoing to determine the content of the package and the aircraft has been cordoned off pending the outcome of the investigation. All other parts of the airport are fully operational.”

Flight KL1473 landed in Glasgow at 10.19 this morning.
